g:HTMLPanel.p: NOTE: The Manage Website Access tab and this tab are incompatible. If you update the configuration through the Manage Website Access, any custom changes made through this tab and its subordinate screens will be lost.
Your first task in securing the site is to restrict access to this page and the other pages that enable you to control access to the site. To do this,

ol.li: Define an 'siteAdmins' group, granting it the ROLE_ACCESS_ADMIN permission
Add yourself as a registered user of the site
Log off then log back in (to update your permissions) in order to gain the ROLE_ACCESS_ADMIN privilege through the 'siteAdmins' group
Remove the ROLE_ACCESS_ADMIN permission from all other groups

g:HTMLPanel.p: After having done this, only you can access these web pages and manage your site's access permissions. You should repeat steps 2 and 3 to add at least one other person to the 'siteAdmins' group.

g:Label.text: Google Earth Ballon Image Display Requirements

g:HTMLPanel.p: Google Earth will not display images in the information ballons unless the ROLE_ATTACHMENT_VIEWER permission is granted to USER_IS_ANONYMOUS.

Whether or not ROLE_ATTACHMENT_VIEWER is assigned to USER_IS_ANONYMOUS, the images remain accessible when the user clicks the View link within the information ballon provided the user has the necessary privileges to view those images (upon the first such access, the user may be prompted to log in).

To further secure your site, you need to decide which permissions (roles) you want an anonymous user (someone who has not logged in) to have, which roles you want users that log in with a gmail.com account to have, and which roles you want certain specified users to have. The later is accomplished by defining a group with the roles you want to assign, entering those specified users into the system as registered users, and assigning them to that group.
These are exactly the steps you did for the 'siteAdmins' group, above.

tr.td: Add, remove or modify user groups
Permissions (roles) are granted to user groups. Restrict access to your data and website by granting these roles to specific user groups.
Add, remove or modify registered users

Permissions can be granted to anonymous users (those not logged in), to all logged-in users (e.g., anyone with a gmail.com account), and to groups of registered users. Define register users to the system though this web page.
Add or remove registered users from user groups
This can be done through either of the above links
Permissions (roles) are granted to user groups. Users possess the roles of the groups they belong to. Manage group memberships to manage the access rights of the users.
Change Aggregate passwords for registered users
This can be done on the Management/Permissions/Manage User Passwords tab

Logins from a device (e.g., ODK Collect) require a password held on this server and specific to this server (an Aggregate password). Set or change that password for selected users here. The password is stored as both a randomly-salted sha-1 hash and as a deterministically-salted md5 hash. The plaintext password is not retained.
